abstract: HSBC Holdings is likely to back down on plans to give Chief Executive Officer Michael Geoghegan a pay increase of as much as 40 percent in 2010 after investors opposed the plan, a person briefed on the discussions told Bloomberg News.
snippet: HSBC Holdings is likely to back down on plans to give Chief Executive Officer Michael Geoghegan a pay increase of as much as 40 percent in 2010 after investors opposed the plan, a person briefed on the discussions told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: HSBC Holdings is likely to back down on plans to give its chief executive officer, Michael Geoghegan, a pay increase of as much as 40 percent in 2010 after investors opposed the plan, a person briefed on the discussions told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: HSBC Said to Cancel Raise for C.E.O.
